title: No RAGrets
description:
- Collaborated with CarbonBridge to apply Natural Language Processing (NLP) to accelerate scientific research in sustainable fuel innovation. Led development of an open-source knowledge graph extraction system that processes research literature on biological carbon conversion, microbial biocatalysis, and algae-based systems for transforming industrial waste gases into sustainable fuels
- Developed an automated pipeline integrating Docling for document parsing and Qwen vision-language models for extracting entities, relationships, and technical concepts from scientific literature
- Created an interactive React-based interface with graph visualization tools for exploring research connections and AI-powered literature review capabilities
- Set up development infrastructure with FastAPI backend, Dgraph graph database, and containerized deployment workflows
- Documented the system architecture, setup procedures, and technical decisions to enable the next UCSC NLP cohort to continue advancing this research tool as I transition to an advisory role
- This work supports CarbonBridge's mission to decarbonize maritime transport by making scientific knowledge more accessible and interconnected for researchers working on biotechnological pathways to sustainable fuels

title: EduMUSE
description:
- Built a sophisticated multi-agent educational AI system that orchestrates specialized CrewAI agents through a modern React interface, transforming how students interact with academic content
- Developed a modular flow architecture enabling systematic comparison of AI methodologies—web search, LLM-based synthesis, and hybrid retrieval—accessible through an intuitive PDF viewer with intelligent text selection
- Implemented a specialized agent ecosystem including ConceptExtractor for academic analysis, SummaryWriter for adaptive content creation, and AssessmentDesigner for pedagogically sound quiz generation
- Integrated Flask-based PDF upload API with CORS support and react-pdf-highlighter, allowing users to upload academic documents and interact with AI agents for real-time content generation
- Successfully integrated podcast generation feature that transforms academic content into engaging audio discussions between AI hosts, expanding the system's multimodal capabilities

title: Multi-Agent AI Orchestration Platform with Web Integration Demo
description:
- Developed a multi-agent conversational AI system that orchestrates specialized AI agents through a modern web interface, combining AutoGen's MagenticOneGroupChat with real-time frontend integration
- Developed custom WebSocket-based communication layer to seamlessly route user interactions between React frontend and AutoGen backend, eliminating terminal dependencies for true web-native AI conversations
- Implemented specialized agent ecosystem including ScientistAgent for analytical responses, ArtistAgent for creative perspectives, and MediaHandlerAgent for multimedia content processing
- Solved complex input routing challenges by creating a custom UserProxyAgent integration that channels human-in-the-loop interactions through the web interface
- Integrated Flask-based media upload API with CORS support and achieved clean, real-time multi-perspective AI responses with intelligent message filtering and robust error handling

title: UCSC RAG Chatbot — A Retrieval-Augmented Assistant for Student Support
description:
- Built a custom chatbot to answer questions about the UCSC NLP Master's Program and related university services using Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) with LangChain, ChromaDB, and LLaMA 3.2
- Integrated Gemini 2.0 Flash for post-response evaluation to ensure factual accuracy and reduce hallucinations by checking relevance, coherence, and bias
- Developed a Swift-based iOS app with Firebase for real-time access, chat history, and user authentication
- Achieved 97% human-evaluated accuracy on a custom 150-question dataset and 71% strict accuracy under Gemini evaluation
- Tested across three LLaMA model sizes (1B, 3B, 8B) and retrieved answers from 77 scraped UCSC-affiliated web pages

title: Robustness and Domain Adaptation in Transformer-Based Question Answering
description:
- Analyzed RoBERTa's robustness across in-domain, adversarial, and out-of-domain QA tasks using SQuAD 2.0 and the Covid-QA biomedical dataset
- Applied Low-Rank Adaptation (LoRA) to fine-tune RoBERTa efficiently, reducing trainable parameters while improving accuracy on specialized biomedical text
- Introduced sliding window inference and CLS-token masking for long and unanswerable contexts, enhancing answer alignment and minimizing false positives
- Achieved +6.41 EM / +14.84 F1 on Covid-QA dev and +5.33 EM / +10.54 F1 on test, demonstrating strong domain transfer with adapter-based tuning
- Identified failure modes in QA under ambiguity and contradiction, informing best practices for robust transformer deployment

title: Sentiment Analysis Minibatching
description:
- Developed sentiment classifiers using Logistic Regression and LSTM models on the IMDB movie review dataset, exploring the impact of batch size and learning rate on model performance
- Implemented dynamic mini-batch training with PyTorch and spaCy, handling over 50,000 variable-length reviews with custom tokenization and data loading
- Benchmarked configurations across batch sizes and learning rates, achieving up to 90.4% validation accuracy with LR and 90.1% with LSTM
- Highlighted efficiency–performance trade-offs, showing that intermediate batch sizes (e.g., 16) yielded optimal convergence and generalization
- Demonstrated that smaller batch sizes increased training time but preserved beneficial gradient noise for model robustness

title: Modernized ELIZA Rogerian Therapist Chatbot
description:
- Enhanced the classic ELIZA chatbot with NLP techniques to better handle humor, misspellings, contractions, and flirtation while preserving its therapeutic tone
- Implemented a modular spell-checker using TextBlob and SpaCy to correct typos without altering named entities or disrupting context
- Designed custom rules for laughter and flirtatious input, prompting deeper dialogue or redirection to maintain professional tone
- Developed contraction-aware lemmatization to improve pattern matching while respecting ELIZA's rule-based structure
- Increased chatbot realism and user engagement by addressing ambiguous, emotional, or non-serious inputs through modular NLP enhancements

title: Neural Machine Translation: Subword vs. Word-Level Tokenization
description:
- Built French-to-English NMT models using Transformer and CNN architectures on the IWSLT 2013 dataset within the Fairseq framework
- Compared Byte Pair Encoding (BPE) and Moses whole-word tokenization to evaluate effects on training speed, vocabulary size, and translation quality
- Tuned hyperparameters (dropout, model depth) to optimize BLEU scores and reduce overfitting
- Conducted both quantitative (SacreBLEU) and qualitative analysis to assess output fluency and semantic accuracy
- Found that whole-word tokenization achieved a top BLEU score of 28.98, while BPE improved OOV handling and convergence speed

title: POS Tagging with Hidden Markov Models and Viterbi Algorithm
description:
- Developed a POS tagging system using a Hidden Markov Model (HMM) and implemented the Viterbi algorithm for sequence decoding.
- Designed and implemented log-space computations for numerical stability, addressing challenges like data sparsity and unseen words using fallback probabilities.
- Leveraged dynamic programming for efficient computation and implemented structured backpointer mechanisms for accurate sequence reconstruction.
- Evaluated the system using token-level accuracy and F1-scores to ensure reliability and effectiveness.

title: Airline Sentiment Preprocessing and Modeling
description:
- Developed a pipeline for sentiment analysis on the Twitter US Airline Sentiment dataset, focusing on data preprocessing, custom tokenization, and machine learning classification.
- Applied advanced text cleaning techniques, including regex-based tokenization, lemmatization, and emoji normalization.
- Trained a support vector machine (SVM) with TF-IDF features, achieving 80.89% test accuracy through preprocessing optimizations and ablation studies.
- Delivered actionable insights into sentiment trends across airlines and user behavior using visualizations.

title: Building and Evaluating N-Gram Language Models
description:
- Built N-Gram models (Unigram, Bigram, Trigram) and Interpolated N-Gram models to predict word sequences and measure perplexity on a subset of the One Billion Word Language Modeling Benchmark dataset.
- Implemented linear interpolation smoothing and tunable OOV handling to address unseen data and improve model generalization.
- Optimized interpolation weights (λ1, λ2, λ3) to enhance contextual predictions and reduce perplexity.
- Analyzed model performance across datasets and demonstrated the effectiveness of interpolation for handling sparse data.

title: Feature Engineering for Multiclass Classification
description:
- Developed a text classification pipeline for an e-commerce dataset, leveraging feature engineering techniques and multi-class classification models such as SVM, Logistic Regression, and Decision Tree.
- Implemented GloVe embeddings, Sublinear TF-IDF, and Bag-of-Words features to optimize model performance.
- Conducted hyperparameter tuning and evaluated performance using metrics like macro-average F1-scores, confusion matrices, and ROC curves.
- Delivered models with high accuracy and efficient feature representations for text data.

title: Slot Tagging of Natural Language Utterances
description:
- Designed and implemented a BiLSTM with attention mechanism for slot tagging tasks, achieving 75.37% accuracy and F1 scores of 0.950 (sklearn) and 0.839 (seqeval).
- Integrated pre-trained GloVe embeddings and created custom embedding matrices for semantic token representations.
- Tuned hyperparameters, including dropout rates and learning rates, to improve model performance and generalization.
- Evaluated token- and sequence-level metrics to capture complex token dependencies.

title: Transformer Language Model on Penn Treebank Dataset
description:
- Developed a Transformer Encoder model for autoregressive language modeling on the Penn Treebank dataset, reducing test perplexity from 83.35 to 39.11.
- Optimized model architecture with sinusoidal positional encoding and multi-head attention, improving generalization on small datasets.
- Conducted extensive hyperparameter tuning to balance model complexity and training efficiency.
- Evaluated predictive accuracy across training, validation, and test sets, validating the model's scalability for constrained datasets.

title: Feature Engineering and Sentiment Analysis
description:
- Built a text classification pipeline for Amazon and IMDb datasets, exploring feature engineering techniques and comparing custom and scikit-learn models.
- Implemented custom Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Tree, and Logistic Regression classifiers with Laplacian smoothing and N-gram features.
- Achieved 89% accuracy with SVM + TF-IDF on Amazon reviews and 87% validation accuracy with Logistic Regression + Bigrams on IMDb reviews.
- Leveraged advanced metrics like binary and macro F1-scores to evaluate model performance.

title: Relation Extraction from Natural Language using PyTorch
description:
- Developed a Multi-Layer Perceptron (MLP) model to extract core relations from natural language utterances using the Freebase schema.
- Utilized static embeddings from spaCy and trained the model with K-fold cross-validation for robust performance across folds.
- Applied MultiLabelSoftMarginLoss to handle multi-label predictions effectively, achieving an average F1-score of ~0.91 and accuracy of ~0.86.
- Optimized the architecture with batch normalization and dropout layers, demonstrating the model's utility in knowledge graph enrichment and conversational AI.
